name: Atlantic Gray Whale
info: The Atlantic gray whale went extinct in the 18th century due to hunting. It once lived in the North Atlantic Ocean.

name: Dodo
info: The dodo was a flightless bird endemic to Mauritius. It became extinct due to hunting and invasive species.

name: Elephant Bird
info: One of the largest birds ever to exist, native to Madagascar. Overhunting and habitat destruction led to its extinction.

name: Great Auk
info: A flightless seabird hunted to extinction for feathers, meat, and oil.

name: Giant Moa
info: A massive flightless bird from New Zealand, wiped out by overhunting by early humans.

name: Irish Elk
info: Known for its enormous antlers, the Irish elk went extinct after the last Ice Age.

name: Passenger Pigeon
info: Once one of the most abundant birds in North America, hunted to extinction in just a few decades.

name: Steller's Sea Cow
info: A giant marine mammal discovered in 1741 and hunted to extinction only 27 years later.

name: Quagga
info: A zebra subspecies with unique striping. Extinct due to hunting in South Africa.

name: Pyrenean Ibex
info: One of the few species to go extinct twice—once naturally, and again after a failed cloning attempt.

name: Tasmanian Tiger
info: Also known as the thylacine, hunted to extinction in Australia.

name: Woolly Mammoth
info: One of the most iconic Ice Age animals. Some populations survived on islands until 2000 BCE.

name: Baiji (Yangtze River Dolphin)
info: Declared functionally extinct due to pollution, habitat loss, and river traffic.

name: Newfoundland Wolf
info: A wolf subspecies native to Newfoundland, driven extinct by bounty hunting.

name: Pinta Island Tortoise
info: The species included 'Lonesome George', the last known individual, who died in 2012.

name: Golden Toad
info: Disappeared rapidly due to climate change and fungal disease.

name: Broad-billed Parrot
info: A large parrot from Mauritius, extinct likely due to hunting and invasive species.

name: Mauritius Turtle Dove
info: Endemic to Mauritius, disappeared due to habitat loss.

name: Mauritius Grey Parrot
info: A large parrot native to Mauritius, extinct from hunting.

name: Mauritian Wood Pigeon
info: Another bird lost to the ecological collapse of Mauritius.

name: Bermuda Saw-whet Owl
info: A small owl species wiped out shortly after human arrival.

name: La Brea Owl
info: Known from the La Brea tar pits, disappeared in the late Pleistocene.

name: Delalande’s Coua
info: A Malagasy cuckoo species lost due to habitat destruction.
